results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 037. Country jazz
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Bob Kingsbury and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The 25th Australian Jazz Convention, 1970, brought 600 musicians and enthusiasts to Dubbo, N.S.W. This annual event startled many of the local inhabitants, especially those who watched the parade of musicians down the main street. Featured artists and groups were the Original Graeme Bell Australian Jazz Band, Allan Stott’s Hottentots, Lachie Thompson’s New Whispering gold Orchestra, Nick Polites and his New Year’s Revllers and the Dubbo Corps Salvation Army Band.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Brealey, Bob Kingsbury and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Anzac: a nation's heritage
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Denys Brown, Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A commemoration of the 50th anniversary of the landing by Australian and New Zealand troops on the Gallipoli Peninsula. Highlights include memorial services in Australia, New Zealand and Britain, a re-enactment at Anzac cove and scenes of Gallipoli and Troy today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Robinson, Denys Brown, Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Antarctic Vigil
results.creator_credit: Film Australia and Dept of Interior for the Australian Film Board in association with The Australian National Anatarctic Research Expedition
results.brief_description: An account of research undertaken by Australian scientists at the Antarctic outposts of Macquarie, Kerguelen and Heard Islands. Shows life on these islands including work at the meteorological stations and studies of the unusual animal, bird and plant life found in Arctic regions.

results.title: An Agricultural Officer in Papua and New Guinea
results.creator_credit: William Shepherd, Maslyn Williams, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Presents the work being done in Papua and New Guinea by the Department of Agriculture to produce better stock and crops, and the opportunities for young men in this field. Various special training and research centres are shown, including the veterinary laboratory, rubber experimental station, cattle breeding station, and extension centres where people are trained as Agricultural Field Assistants.

results.title: Aborigines of the Sea Coast
results.creator_credit: Charles P. Mountford, Dept of Interior and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film records the 1948 expedition to Arnhem Land sponsored by the National Geographical Society and the Smithsonian Institution. It shows the life of sea coast Aborigines at Yirrkala in the north-eastern corner of Arnhem Land. Demonstrates how, as children, they learn to handle canoes made from bark and as adults how they use them for fishing and hunting turtle. Shows how the canoes are made by stripping bark from a tree. The women of the tribe do the camp chores, collect firewood, make string bags, hunt goannas, and search for food plants.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles P. Mountford, Dept of Interior and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Trampoline: flavours that jump out at you
results.brief_description: A sound example of the corporate video documentary style with controlled use of generic conventions including a considered and well paced structure, a clean soundtrack and an understanding of the uses for which such productions are made.

results.title: Subterfuge
results.brief_description: This black drama employs assured age appropriate actors in a tight, well lit and carefully shot piece with a storyline that asks the audience to piece together the clues.

results.title: Push
results.brief_description: This engaging work explores the narrative device of ‘what if?’ to create a quirky and fun filled piece demonstrating sophisticated control of compositing in a playful exploration of the possibilities of technology.

results.title: The Note
results.brief_description:
This mature exploration of difficult relationships utilises understated camerawork to convey an assured and gripping narrative. Strong visual composition and the use of motif combine with an effective soundtrack to create a piece that does not underestimate the role of the audience.
Music composed and performed by Madeleine Jay. ‘Moonlight Sonata’ by Beethoven.
